pkgmetadata.longdescription: The Apache HTTP Server Project is an effort to develop and maintain an open-source HTTP server for modern operating systems. The goal of this project is to provide a secure, efficient and extensible server that provides HTTP services in sync with the current HTTP standards.

use.flag: Group authorizations based on host (name or IP address). Available in Apache HTTP Server 2.3 as a compatibility module with previous versions of Apache httpd 2.x. Please see mod_authz_host.
Provides core authentication capabilities common to all authentication providers (functionality provided by mod_authn_alias in previous versions).
Provides core authorization capabilities to various authorization/authorization modules, such as mod_authn_file and mod_authz_user.
Disk based storage module for the HTTP caching filter. Similar to mod_mem_cache in 2.2
A shared object cache provider which provides for creation and access to a cache backed by a high-performance cyclic buffer inside a shared memory segment.
Link in apache2 modules statically rather then plugins
